speech: Excerpts from 3.05 "Progeny" and 3.10 "The Return Part 1" are shown.
Woolsey cowers in a corner of a darkened corridor. He hears a noise, gets up, and cautiously approaches, holding a pistol.
Woolsey jumps back, startled, then looks chastened.
Then I've just exposed my position.
I'm sorry. I'm not very good at this.
O'Neill and Woolsey move back to where Woolsey had been before. O'Neill pulls out a power bar from his pocket and hands it to Woolsey.
He starts eating the bar ravenously, then peers at O'Neill.
Was this all you could find?
(sarcastically) No. Actually there was a lovely buffet.
Well, the Stargate Ops is crawlin with `em. There's no way we're gonna get across to the Jumper Bay.
O'Neill and Woolsey sit on the floor, against the corridor wall.
Well, as long as the life signs detectors aren't working in these damaged areas, we should be able to hold out until they rescue us.
Uh, Richard, there's not going to be a rescue.
Landry has standing orders to nuke the city if there's any sign of a foothold situation.
What kind of a standing order is that?
The puddle jumper hovers in front of the active Stargate.
That's confirmation. The Gate shield is lowered.
I hope this little plan of ours works.
The puddle jumper flies through the active wormhole.
The puddle jumper flies into the Gate room via the wormhole. Its shields are active. Replicators immediately begin to fire on the ship from various positions.
Authentication code Alpha Six Delta Charlie Niner. General O'Neill, Woolsey, do you copy?
The scene switches between Sheppard's and O'Neill's locations as they communicate by radio.
Yes, sir. I need to know if you're anywhere near Stargate Operations.
(into radio) That's good. Can't talk right now, sir. Get back to you in a couple of hours. Sheppard, out. (to McKay) Drop the package.
The puddle jumper goes into reverse. The event horizon has already shut down, so the vessel flies back through the inactive Stargate and through the glass behind it.
Two replicators approach a black box sitting under where the puddle jumper was. It emits a beeping sound that becomes more rapid.
As the puddle jumper flies away, the tower housing Stargate Operations explodes into a fireball.
Everyone looks on in amazement, and Ronon smiles.
The puddle jumper flies away from Atlantis.
Why can't he get back to us for two hours?
Harriman sits at his station. Landry paces behind him.
It's coming up on 2300 hours, sir.
I have to assume Sheppard heard my message and chose to ignore it.
There's no way to be a hundred percent certain, sir, but...
He heard me alright. They're already in Pegasus doing goodness knows what. Which leaves me no choice but to lock out their IDCs and invalidate their personal authentication codes.
But, sir, if they're successful in rescuing--

We have no way of knowing whether they've been successful or if they've been compromised. I have my standing orders, and I'm damned well going to follow them. Now, when you're done locking out those IDCs, have Doctor Lee report to my office.
The puddle jumper flies in space around the planet.
It's good to be back, however briefly.
I feel like I'm gonna be ill.
All right, just take some deep breaths, Carson.
Should we not have informed General O'Neill of our plan?
He knows we're here. We'll contact him again as soon as we get closer to the city.
Well, that is gonna be easier said than done. With all those hits we took, it's gonna be impossible for me to convert the shield back to a cloak.
I mean "not possible". What do you think I mean?
Well, hopefully we took out the sensors when we blew the tower.
Well, you said they could rebuild remarkably fast. How long before they restore critical systems?
(shrugging) Who knows? A couple of hours?
(inspired) If we time this right, this could work to our advantage.
A panel beeps and the HUD appears in front of them, displaying something in space nearby.
Got him! Right where we left him!
True. His power levels are barely registering. It's no wonder the Replicators didn't find him.
All right, I'll swing around and pick him up. Watch yourselves, I'm closing the bulkhead.
The bulkhead door closes behind Teyla and Ronon.
The puddle jumper approaches Niam floating in space. The cargo door opens.
Will we not be vulnerable to the same nanovirus with which Niam infected Elizabeth?
Teyla, Ronon, and Weir exchange nervous looks. Beckett still looks ill.

He's been floating in space for over a month now. He's resting in such a harsh environment, direct solar radiation has severely diminished his power levels. We're fairly certain he's almost completely incapacitated.
He's mostly dead. Besides, we don't have a choice. He's the key to our whole plan.
(nervously) All right. But if he even twitches...
Ronon brandishes his weapon. Weir smiles.
Got him. Closing the rear hatch. (to Beckett) Take the seat.
Sheppard joins Teyla and Ronon. Beckett replaces him in the pilot's chair.

McKay turns, a handheld computer at ready. The bulkhead door opens and Sheppard, Teyla, and Ronon all point the anti-replicator weapons at Niam. Niam lies sprawled on his back, looking frozen. They turn back to McKay, who winces and gets up to join them.
McKay and Sheppard move closer to Niam. McKay starts scanning Niam.
Okay. Okay, this is good. His power levels are minimal but not too minimal. I'm fairly sure he doesn't have the juice to regain consciousness.
McKay stumbles back as Ronon and Sheppard stand at ready. Niam's fingers settle back. His chest rises and falls as if breathing.
McKay more cautiously approaches with the handheld device.
Repairs are under way in Stargate Operations, but we have lost all main sensors.
We are trying to route all the telemetry through these terminals but they were not designed to take on so many systems.
We have stationed several observers around the city. If the gateship returns, we will detect it visually.
They communicated briefly with someone within the city. We'll send search parties here and here.
He indicates places on a glass schematic of the city.
All of the Ancients were killed. Their commander attempted to conceal that fact as I probed her mind.
There may have also been a small number of humans.
They may be hiding where the sensors are inoperable. If we want to capture the ones who attacked us, we must first capture those they came for.
I think we're good to go.
All right. I'll take us back.
Sheppard gets up and moves to the pilot chair.
Why don't we do this from here?
Render the Replicators helpless, Rodney? Remember the plan?
Of course I remember the plan. It's my plan.
Uh, actually, using Niam was Elizabeth's plan.
It was mostly my plan. (muttering petulantly) It was my freezing program.
You said they'd be frozen in place six or seven hours. Why not do it now?
Because I've gotta keep Niam at nominal power levels, otherwise we risk him waking up. Look, low power means short range. Short range means we need to get closer.
Good to be back home, huh?
Hmph. There's no place like it.
Landry is seated behind his desk. Lee enters and sits in one of the chairs.
I realize I was duped, General, but they were incredible. It was like a scene out of The Sting.
Calm down, Bill. That's not why I brought you in here.
(continuing) In my defense, this was obviously something they had planned for a long time--
Forget about it. I'd like to know your opinion on the best way to disable the Gate Bridge between galaxies.
Okay. Uh, well, umm, I-I suppose if one were to detonate a Mark Nine at the midway station, that'd pretty much do it.
I thought so. I'd like you to supervise the preparation of a Mark Nine to keep our options open.
Lee slumps back in his chair.
Ah. You know, you could always dismantle it. Of course, it would take a bit more time.
Landry stands, but Lee remains slumped in the chair.
(shocked) Wow. Th-that is such a shame.
Lee stays seated in the chair, lost in thought.
Doctor, why are you still in my office?
The puddle jumper flies towards the city.
All right, we're about a mile out.
Okay, I'll start broadcasting the virus now, but, uh, we're gonna need to get closer than that.
A replicator standing guard on a balcony spots the ship. In another part of the city, a hatch opens, and five drones fly out, heading towards the puddle jumper.

Sheppard flies the puddle jumper through the city in an evasive pattern, dodging the four drones chasing them as they maneuver past the various buildings. Sheppard is able to have some detonate against other buildings, but some are still on their tail.
Woolsey and O'Neill can hear the drones exploding.
But is it Sheppard attacking the Replicators, or the Replicators attacking Sheppard?
How did they even get here? Through the Gate?
I've been sitting next to you through the whole thing. Why do you think I have more information?
Woolsey drops his pistol and shrugs off his loosened tie in frustration.
Look, I told you I wasn't good at this.
He said he'd be back in a couple of hours. That gives him a good... (checking watch) ...eleven seconds.
Another explosion happens, rocking the corridor.
If we keep this up, there won't be much of a city left to save.
(annoyed) I'll try to run the drones into your least favorite buildings. McKay!
Well, if I give him any more power, he'll wake up and kill us all!
(bitingly, to McKay) Sheppard can't keep this up forever.
One of the drones strikes the puddle jumper on its starboard side, though shields cushion the impact.
Alright, I've had enough. I've got a different idea.
The puddle jumper engines retracts and it dives into the ocean. The drones do not follow.
It's been well over eleven seconds.
Yes. But you've been ignoring the dramatic element of...suspense.
(over radio) General O'Neill, are you there, sir?
(into radio) Yes, we're here. You're late.
Sorry, sir. Had to go into space and pick up some...frozen goods.
(into radio) Whatever. Where are you now?
We're not exactly inside the city yet. We're headed toward an underwater Jumper Bay.
The jumper moves through the water.
Well, what we think may be an underwater Jumper Bay.
Is that Doctor Weir I hear?
Yes, General. It's good to hear your voice too.
(over radio) I didn't say it was good, Elizabeth. Please, don't be offended as I express my "surprise" that Landry would send you on a mission like this.
Well, sir, General Landry didn't sanction this mission.
So, am I to assume you are not surrounded by heavily-armed SG teams and young strapping marines?
You've got Colonel Sheppard, Ronon, Teyla, McKay, myself, and Doctor Beckett.
(sarcastically) Woo! Doctor Beckett, is it? Well, I'm comforted.
Okay, ready to open the lock.
We've got a plan, sir, a...good one.
Yes, Colonel, I'm sure you do. But in the unlikely event you don't fail miserably, you're fired.
Through the window, it can be seen that Sheppard is maneuvering the jumper into an underwater bay.
Okay, closing the outer door. Yes. Now, I just have to pressurize the compartment and we are...
The computer beeps. McKay looks surprised.
It's not letting me do it.
Weir steps to the rear of the puddle jumper.
Sheppard gets up to look at the leaks. Beckett immediately mans the pilot chair.
Well, guess we took some damage.
(panicking) I just want to point out that this was not my idea.
You said, "Get us close to the city." This is pretty damned close!
All right. Just open up the outer doors. I'll figure something else out.
I don't think I'm gonna be able to open the outer door.
I think it might be jammed.
Yeah, I'd have to agree with you on that.
This part of the plan isn't going so well.
The bay is still filled with water.
There must be a manual override somewhere.
In the bay's control room, yes.
Sheppard reaches up to check something on the ceiling.
...which is sealed from the other side.
Perhaps General O'Neill can reach it.
Good. Okay, give me half an hour to get Niam to the right power level, so we can do this.
We've got more than one fracture. We don't have that kind of time. (into radio) General O'Neill? We're gonna need a favor.
Woolsey and O'Neill head towards a hatch with ladder access to the next level.
The conversation switches between McKay in the jumper and the others in the corridor.
(over radio) Okay, there should be a hatch leading down to the next level. Do you see it?
Yep. Sure do. We see it.
The Control Room should be almost directly below.
Woolsey and O'Neill look down into the hatch and exchange looks.
Well, the level below is completely flooded, too.
Ah. I, uh, couldn't convince you to take a swim today, could I?
O'Neill sighs. He hands his P-90 over to Woolsey and takes off his outer fatigue shirt and boots.
All right. If you hear something, don't call out to it. Shoot it.
Anything that's not me is a Replicator, so don't hesitate.
(nervously) You won't be gone long, will you?
Uh, kinda depends on the temperature of the water. Let's see.
He dips a toe into the water and yanks it out quickly.
(into radio) McKay? What do I do once I get down there?
It's a manual override. It should be in the center of the console. It'll be obvious once you get in there.
O'Neill sets the radio down on the railing and starts climbing down the ladder. He takes several deep breaths.
place: ATLANTIS CORRIDOR, ONE LEVEL ABOVE JUMPER BAY

speech: O'Neill dives under and starts swimming towards the control room. It is the second room after the hatch. O'Neill can see the jumpers in the bay. He swims around a station in the center of the control room. There is a panel on each of four sides, and all are filled with buttons, knobs, and levers. O'Neill looks nonplussed, then heads back to get more air. He surfaces with a gasp to find Woolsey waiting.
Woolsey reaches for the radio and hands it to O'Neill.
(angry) You and I have very different ideas of what "obvious" is.
Well, I've never seen it before!
There are dozens of controls down there I wouldn't even know how to describe!
place: ATLANTIS CORRIDOR, ONE LEVEL ABOVE JUMPER BAY

speech: Well, it's an emergency control. It should be among the most prominent.

place: ATLANTIS CORRIDOR, ONE LEVEL ABOVE JUMPER BAY

speech: O'Neill dives again and enters the control chamber. He finds a lever and tries it. It controls the door he used. It closes. Panicked he keeps pulling the lever, then the one next to it. The door opens slightly. He goes to the other side and finds another lever. He pulls that and water starts to drain out of the jumper bay. He turns to leave, but the lever snaps back up, stopping the procedure. O'Neill has been underwater too long. He goes to the door and has to physically pry it open enough to get out.
On the surface, Woolsey keeps checking his watch. O'Neill surfaces.
God, you can hold your breath a long time! You almost gave me a heart attack!
(over radio) General. It sounded like you had the right control. Why did you stop?
(into radio) It's a dead man's switch. I have to hold it in place.
place: ATLANTIS CORRIDOR, ONE LEVEL ABOVE JUMPER BAY
ATLANTIS CORRIDOR, ONE LEVEL ABOVE JUMPER BAY

speech: He dives again and heads directly to the lever, holding it down.
The team sees the water level lowering.
He's doing it! He's almost got it!
(over radio) Tell him, like, thirty more seconds and we're ...
Woolsey quickly shuts off the radio so no one can hear. He turns to the corridor, holding his rifle.
Under water, O'Neill sits still with his eyes closed, holding the control.
place: ATLANTIS CORRIDOR, ONE LEVEL ABOVE JUMPER BAY

speech: Sheppard and Ronon are passing out weapons.
Something's wrong. (he lowers the cargo hold door) McKay, you stay here and reprogram Niam. We're gonna go meet General O'Neill and Woolsey, all right? We'll wait for your okay.
O'Neill breaks the surface again, looking triumphant.
He looks up to see weapons pointed at him by two replicators. More are holding Woolsey captive.
place: ATLANTIS CORRIDOR, ONE LEVEL ABOVE JUMPER BAY

speech: Woolsey and O'Neill are marched into the brig, the Replicators holding them by painful grips to the shoulders. When in the room, they are released.
Sheppard and the others find several discharged cartridges from where Woolsey must have tried to hold back the replicators before capture.
Which means their minds will be probed for information any minute now.
(over radio) McKay, fire up that virus.
I am working as fast as I can.
The Replicators have O'Neill and Woolsey.
Unfortunately, that information can't make me work any faster.
What were you doing in the flooded sections of the city?

Well, I was planning to retire, but, man, is that overrated. I mean, it's not like I'm a workaholic or anything, but, you know, I like to stay active...with the community. It's-it's a health maintenance sort of thing, you know?
The replicators hold Woolsey and O'Neill as Talus and Cetus approach.
I don't like where this is going.
Talus and Cetus place their hands into O'Neill's and Woolsey's heads.
O'Neill and Talus stand on the ramp of the Gate room, an active wormhole beside them.
Your ability to resist is quite remarkable, General O'Neill.
(smiling) It's not the first time I've had a hand in my head, as it were.
If you do not give me what I am looking for, I am sure Richard Woolsey will.
I'll tell you what, you look around, and I'll tell you if you're gettin' warmer or colder, alright?
Talus's expression changes to one of satisfaction.
They release Woolsey and O'Neill, who cry out in pain.
That was the worst thing I've ever experienced.
O'Neill puts a hand on Woolsey's shoulder.
Okay, if I...that should... Yeah. Okay, yes. Stand by. (into radio) I've got his power levels about as high as I'm comfortable with. I'm gonna try to get him to ...
McKay suddenly senses something and turns around. Niam stands behind him, fully conscious.
You've been warned about tampering with our base code, Doctor. You won't get a second chance.
McKay fumbles for the ARG and is able to reach it and fire before Niam can touch him.
(panicked) Fall back to the Jumper! We're gonna need a new plan.
The rest of the team have joined McKay in the jumper. Sheppard studies the broken replicator blocks from where Niam disintegrated.
They must have got to O'Neill and Woolsey.
O'Neill would've never given us away.
Well, they know we're here and how we got in.
Which is how they were able to reactivate Niam, which pretty much screws Plan A.
Could you activate the freezing program another way?
No. I need to load the program directly into a Replicator and spread it that way.
All right, so that plan's out the window. We need another one.
Well, these weapons blow them apart, right? I say we just start killing `em.

Well, normally I would share your run-and-gun enthusiasm, but these weapons are only gonna work for so long before they manage to identify the frequency they use to disrupt the bonds that hold the Replicators together.

Exactly. Look, the freezing plan would have worked because they would be unable to communicate with each other while we were blasting them, but the more we shoot, the greater the likelihood these weapons are gonna become ineffective.
Okay, so what are our options?
(snapping his fingers) C-4. How much do we have?
We need to split into groups.
I was gonna suggest that anyway. Why? What are you thinking?
We far outnumber them. If we conduct a search...
We will be able to locate them more effectively once repairs are complete.
The damage was severe. We had to dismantle our ship to provide the raw materials.
Once repaired, Atlantis will be all the ship we need.
Woolsey and O'Neill sleep. McKay and Sheppard enter the room, destroy the Replicator guard, and approach the cell.
Alright, get 'em out of here. I'll stand guard.
Sheppard stands by the entrance to the room. McKay uses his handheld computer and tries to work on the door controls. O'Neill appears very irritated, Woolsey relieved.
No! You should be saying: "thanks for the rescue"!
(contrite) Oh! Uh, right. Thanks. Should have you outta there in no time. This won't take long at all. (His face falls.) Oh, my. They've changed the codes.
But you can crack it, right? You need to get us out of here.
Yeah, of course I can. Just give me like one...two seconds.
So I guess that frozen Replicator plan didn't pan out?
(still irritated) How's that Plan B working for ya? Good?
Actually, it's more like Plan C. "C" as in C-4, if you catch my drift.
Let's just say that we're concerned the Daedalus won't be able to carry out your standing orders.
What?!? To destroy Atlantis with nuclear weapons? I thought we were past that! Why are we going back to that?
Yeah. If we plant charges in all ten of the shield emitters before the Daedalus arrives, that way when the Replicators try to activate the shield...
The C-4 detonates, the Daedalus beams a warhead into the city, and we all get vaporized.
Sounds more like a Plan F, doesn't it? As in: "we are totally f--
(interrupting) If we can fight our way back to the bay, then we'll be able to fly the jumper to a safe distance. That is, if we can get the underwater bay door open.
You can't even open this door!
We got company. (to O'Neill) Sorry, sir, we're gonna have to come back for you.
No-no-no-no-no-no, we can't leave them here. They know too much.
Uh, uh, I mean, they guessed most of it.
Sheppard smacks McKay in the back of the head.
What, and you filled in the rest?!
I thought I would have time to get them out of here! (to O'Neill) Look, just forget what I said.
O'Neill has been watching this exchange shrewdly.
Sheppard, get out of here while you still can. That's an order.
Sorry it has to be this way.
(resigned) So, we're back to being vaporized.
The Stargate is active. Landry enters the room and stands by Harriman's station.
We're receiving a subspace data burst via midway in the Alpha Site. Daedalus is holding station at their failsafe point and awaiting your order.
Reply to Colonel Caldwell that General O'Neill's order stands. Atlantis is to be destroyed at all costs.
Good. We are well ahead of schedule.
Perfect. Now let's find some place out of the way and wait for this thing to be over.
Come on. One more to go.
Almost done. We haven't run into a single Replicator.
Woolsey and O'Neill said that there are hundreds of them. Where are they?
...And it's all over but the crying.
There is a sharp noise and then a humming.
He starts looking at the readout screens.
No wonder they weren't coming after us. They've been busy repairing the city.
They brought their ZPMs to power the stardrive.
The city about to take off.
They'll still have to activate the shield to take off, won't they? We got most of their emitters.
Yeah, "most" ain't gonna cut it. For this plan to work, it is all or nothing.
What do they want to fly around for?
Well, maybe they wanna fly home, back to their homeworld.
And take on the Daedalus. Well, how are we gonna stop 'em?
Drones. They fired drones at us. That means the Chair is active and powered.
You wanna fire drones at the city? We're nowhere near the Chair!
The scene switches between Teyla/Beckett and SHeppard/McKay.
(into radio) You want me to do what?!
(into radio) Just do what I say.
All right, I'll give it a try. But no apologies if I happen to destroy the entire bloody city.
Stardrive, Carson. Concentrate on the stardrive.
And, Teyla, you may have to fight your way in.
Use your ARG sparingly. They may build up an immunity. You may have to go to Plan ... B.
Teyla enters and destroys the four guards there with two ARGs.
Beckett enters and approaches the chair.
He sits in the chair and activates it.
The hole in the window is still present where the Puddle Jumper escaped, but another window has appeared behind it. Everything else looks fine. The Replicators return to the controls.
They've taken out the guards in the Chair Room.
Beckett scrunches his face in concentration.
Drones come out through a tube in the city. The three drones rise and then fall.
The drones go underwater and head underneath the city.
The room rocks from an explosion. Talus indicates some Replicators should go respond.
A search and destroy team is on their way to the Chair Room now.
Make sure they understand we need them alive.

Beckett fumbles to get out the chair and raise his sidearm, but by the team he positions himself, Teyla has been stunned, and Beckett is outnumbered. He slowly lowers his sidearm and kneels in surrender.
Replicators grab Beckett and manhandle him and Teyla out of the room.
Ronon and Weir finish as Replicators arrive. One grabs Weir as Ronon loses a fight with two others.
Sheppard and McKay finish up and are instantly surrounded by Replicators.
And I was so sure we were gonna survive this one.
They surrender and are led away.
McKay and Sheppard are thrown into a cell where the rest of the rescue team are.
Bring the prisoners from the other cell.
Probably saving us for a little recreational mind-probing. Did everyone get the...?
So did we. In the nick of time.
Woolsey and O'Neill are led into the cell. Talus stands at the doorway.
Did you really think you'd be able to stop us?
Well, of course we did. Why else would we be here?
Colonel? Am I gonna have to fire you?
No, sir. I think you'll have that to look forward to when we get back.
I'm afraid your plan has been discovered, Colonel Sheppard. It is over.
Talus glances at Woolsey, and everyone stares at him.
(protesting) He put his hand in my forehead. How can you resist that?
Well, I like to close my eyes and think of England.

Mr. Woolsey informed us of everything we need to know. All of your C-4 has been removed from the emitters. I'm afraid they won't be destroyed when the Daedalus arrives...which should be in any moment. Your plan has failed.
Another Replicator holds out the C-4 they've collected. Weir looks disappointed.
(over intercom) Talus. The Daedalus is approaching the planet.
(over intercom) As expected. Activate the shield.
(snapping his fingers) C-4. How much do we have?
We need to split into groups.
I was gonna suggest that anyway. Why? What are you thinking?
If we're gonna destroy these guys using Replicator disruptors, we have to hit them all at once. We'll probably only get a dozen or so shots off before they manage to figure out the frequency.
So, what, you gonna get 'em all to stand in one place at the same time?
Clever, yes. Or we could figure out a way to send one massive blast through the city. Look, follow me.
McKay is showing the inside of an emitter to the others, demonstrating while he speaks.

Atlantis has ten of these emitters with which it creates the city's shields. So, if we can interface the crystals from the disrupter weapons with those of the shield emitters, we should be able to trigger a massive anti-Replicator wave throughout the city.
Okay, that's where splitting into teams comes in.

Exactly. Now, I need to show you how to do this, so listen carefully. You slide out the crystal tray, you take the crystal from the Replicator weapon, you place it in the third slot from the right. Third symbol from the left activates the crystal tray. Clear on that? Great.
While McKay speaks, he replaces the crystal and activates the tray.
The team starts walking away from the emitter.
They are bound to find one of our groups working on the shield emitters.
I already thought of that. That's what the C-4's for.
All right. (holding up an ARG) Once you guys have made all your alterations, avoid using your shiny new toys even if that means getting caught, okay?
If we plant charges in all ten of the shield emitters before the Daedalus arrives, that way when the Replicators try to activate the shield...
(realizing) The C-4 detonates, the Daedalus beams a warhead into the city, and we all get vaporized.
That sounds more like a Plan F, doesn't it?
Sheppard and McKay move away from the brig.
General O'Neill didn't buy it, but I think Woolsey did.
Well, I did win a Sears drama festival award when I was a kid. Could have made it a career if I wanted to.
Cetus and Talus again probe Woolsey's and O'Neill's minds.
We need to get to the shield emitter stations. Remove the C-4 explosive you find there.
I said I wasn't good at this!
(over comm) Talus, the Daedalus is approaching the planet.
The shield raises, and also sends an anti-replicator wave flowing down through the levels of the city. Everywhere replicators disintegrate, including those in the brig.
Ha! It worked! I can't believe it worked!
Well, it was-it was a group effort.
Good old Plan D. Works every time. You guys stay here a sec.
Sheppard and Ronon leave to investigate.
Excuse me, but what just happened?
We turned the shield into a giant Replicator weapon.
Well, I've seen Carter crack enough codes to know that McKay was faking the door thing.
He was? I bought it completely.
I believe that was the point.
Wait a minute, you-you used me?
Okay, we've gotta get to the Control Room and contact the Daedalus.
You see, Richard? You were good for something.
Sir. I have an incoming message from Atlantis.
No, sir. It has Colonel Sheppard's authentication code.
Open a channel. (into comm) Colonel, I'd like to believe this is you.
Well, it is. Authentication code Alpha Delta Charlie Niner Six.
That code is no longer valid, Colonel.
Hey, Caldwell. General Jack O'Neill here. That valid enough for you?
You may have been compromised, sir.
We're lowering the city's shields, Steven. You can send a team to come check us out if you need to. We'll explain everything.
Get a team of marines ready to beam down.
Weir looks around the empty room. O'Neill enters.

Easily. Although their decorating..? Little bit spartan for my liking. But the Replicators did do a fine job on rebuilding Stargate Operations back to its original state. How about yourself? Do you check out okay?
Apparently I don't have any little tiny robots floating in my bloodstream, which is always nice to hear.
O'Neill and Weir share commiserating looks.
Huh! That it is. So what now?
Oh, a jumper ride home to the SGC, followed by a hot shower, followed by a hot toddy, followed by...
I was thinking a...little more selfishly. What are the chances of my team staying here in Atlantis?
Oh. Elizabeth, if it were up to me, I'd--
Right. (after a pause) You can stay.
You're probably still gonna have to get the rubber stamp from the IOA, but since you saved Woolsey's ass and you did a fair job on mine, I don't think that'll be a problem.
Well, I think I speak for all of us when I say thank you very much.
Hey, you came back to rescue me.
Of course, next time, consider bringing Carter with you.
Weir is overcome with emotion and hugs O'Neill. O'Neill is taken aback at first, then hesitantly returns the hug.
